DOC.HEAD: Romania Condemns U.S. Invasion of Panama as `Brutal'
With PM-Panama, Bjt, PM-Romania, Bjt
DOC.TEXT: Romania today condemned the U.S. invasion of Panama as ``brutal aggression'' as its own security forces reportedly shot to death several civilians protesting the hard-line Communist regime. A commentary in the Communist Party daily Scinteia and all other state-run media carried an article headlined, ``An inadmissible act of outstanding international gravity _ the U.S. aggression against the republic of Panana.'' The commentary expressing the official view said Romania had repeatedly called for ``renunciation of measures of force and threat of force'' and for resolving interstate disputes ``by peaceful means only.'' ``All the much more reprehensible are the U.S. actions of brutal aggression as they were taken against a small state which defends its independence and freedom violated by a superpower,'' the Romanian statement said. It added, ``It is the sacred right of each people to decide its own way of life, its political regime, according to its aspirations and traditions.'' ``By stating its solidarity with the Panamanian people's fight for the independence of its country, the Romanian people firmly condemns the U.S. armed intervention ... and asks that an end be put forever to the colonialist, imperialist policy of domination and dictate, of interference in the home afairs of peoples,'' the commentary said. The criticism came on the same day a wave of unrest hit the Romanian capital, Bucharest. The Soviet news agency Tass and a reporter for the Yugoslav news agency Tanjug said security forces fired on protesters in Bucharest today. The Yugoslav reporter said several people were killed and wounded, and military tanks were reported rolling through the city.
